text: hey guys im having some trouble
i want to insert a variable inside my menu to get a certain child element
like so
{{module.carousel_elements[t].linkLabel}}
can you do this?
All paths should start with a slash, according to a release on relative paths
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/New-Feature-Support-for-relative-file-path-references/td-p/284849>

Absolute paths begin with `/`, relative paths start with `.` like mentioned in that link:
> Relative paths should always begin with a period ".", to denote they are not absolute paths, which should always begin with a slash "/".
The note about needing to begin with slash applies to absolute paths
>  As a best practice, all *absolute* paths should begin with a slash
HAHA documentation and no coffee. Sorry!
After looking at your folder structure, it seems basic enough, why bother with relative paths?
Because the folder name is set in `hs upload` and if changed, nothing works properly (and we already use different folder names in some environments)
Good luck tracking down how to fix this… I completely understand the issue with different environements!

Hi everyone, this may be an easy question: I noticed in the HubL language documentation, when you use *content.publish_date_localized* in a blog it uses a localized time zone. But when you use *content.updated* it spits out a weird  13 digit number, is there a way to use a localized time zone with "content.updated?
use the datetime function
Ahh makes sense, thanks!

the `<http://content.blog|content.blog>` <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/variables#blog-variables|variable> used in a standard blog loop (`{% for content in contents %}`) on a listings page returns null. But `group` returns a value. `<http://content.blog|content.blog>` also returns null outside of the loop. This is replicable across all portals so far
the docs say it’s “an alias for group”
How do I get a blog’s settings for `group.show_summary_in_listing` on a regular page? the `group` variable only returns a value on a blog page

Is there a way to determine if a date is within 6 months of the current date? I have a HubDB table with service dates. What I'm trying to do is tag an item if that service date is older than 6 months from the current date.
Actually, I think this might be my ticket: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/filters#minus-time>
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/functions#blog-by-id|This function> solved my problems
